item.title: Gracias a Sonrie Miami por incluirme en su edici√≥n por la...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Gracias a Sonrie Miami por incluirme en su edici√≥n por la Herencia Hispana muy poca gente puede decir que me dieron el t√≠tulo de ‚ÄúIcono‚Äù Jeanette Vizguerra mi lucha no termina hasta que la comunidad inmigrante salga completamente de las sombras y se valore su contribuir a este pa√≠s. Thanks to Sonrie Miami for including me in their edition for Hispanic Heritage, very few people can say that they gave me the title of "Icon" Jeanette Vizguerra, my fight does not end until the immigrant community comes completely out of the shadows and their contribution to this is valued. country

Ella se encuentra entre las 100 personalidades m√°s influyentes de la revista @time ... üôåüèΩ Su nombre es @jeanettevizguerra üë©üèΩ AdemaÃÅs, libra la batalla a TODA VOZ de las pol√≠ticas migratorias de Estados Unidos üó£Ô∏è Una hero√≠na que su pilar es: Seguir luchando contra el sistema que exige papeles para vivir c√≥modamente üßæ Su maravilloso art√≠culo se encuentra en nuestra revista de este mes de OCTUBRE ‚òÄÔ∏è Para leerlo solo debes ingresa en el link de nuestra Biograf√≠a üì≤ . #sonriemiami #revista #magazine #articulo #revistatime #time #time100 #personasmasinfluyentes #americalatina #migrantes #migrantesmexicanos #inmigrantes #migraci√≥n #extranjeros #historiasqueinspiran #extranjeria #derechoshumanis #miamiflorida #SONR√çEYaestasaqu√≠üòÅvia Instagram

item.title: Ôøº Today and through the week our staff and allies across TX...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Ôøº
Today and through the week our staff and allies across TX will be participating in 24-hour fasting to answer Black Alliance for Just Immigration's call for a national week in support of Black migrants. Join us at http://txcivilrights.org/24hourfast to show your support. #DefendBlackImmigrants

Immigrants are so often treated with violence and indignity, and Black immigrants even more so. The data of greater deportations/criminalization of Black migrants is clear in BAJI‚Äôs S...tate of Black Immigrants report, available here: https://bit.ly/BAJIsobi2018.

This week, Black-led organizations like BAJI, Haitian Bridge Alliance, and The Sidewalk School for Children Asylum Seekers are leading the national movement to call for ending Title 42. You can learn more at http://nomoredeportations.org and http://bit.ly/NWAPartnerToolkit‚Ä¶ to join in. Follow these groups to stay tuned.

We understand that fasting is not an option for everyone. We‚Äôre also asking folks to call their Representative and demand they uplift Black-led orgs during this time, and support legislation to end anti-Black legislation like Title 42.

Black migrants already fast and do all they can to protest horrendous detention conditions. Black-led orgs are leading us in this moment, and we must now join in and contribute to ending anti-Blackness however we can. Join the fast: http://txcivilrightsproject.org/24hourfast

See More

item.title: "When we fight and create, we say to our fallen companeros,...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"When we fight and create, we say to our fallen companeros, 'you did not die when they killed you." -Eduardo Galleano

Join us for the 20th anniversary of the Four Directions All Nations March to celebrate the abolishment of Columbus day, to honor our Indigenous relatives who are still resisting the violence of colonialism and genocide, and to remember that we were once free Peoples, and we will be free again.

item.title: Yesterday myfriend Lupe will be having surgery. She will be...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Yesterday myfriend Lupe will be having surgery. She will be having two delicate surgeries done at the same time, one to treat a hernia and the other to treat cancer in her kidney. She is an immigrant mother who has been working very hard to keep going. She does not have any medical insurance and she will have to pay the medical bills for the anesthesia. We‚Äôre asking for community to support her so we can take a little stress off her life. We are also asking for you to keep her in your thoughts and prayers today. Her family is so grateful for the community support. https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-lupe-pay-for-cancer-hernia-‚Ä¶
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: @doctorsforcampclosure and @cuanschutz_sihr will host a screening and panel discussion of The Facility on Thursday March...
item.content:encoded:
@doctorsforcampclosure and @cuanschutz_sihr will host a screening and panel discussion of The Facility on Thursday March 4 at 7 pm MST.

Aurora’s GEO ICE facility is a private immigrant detention center whose shadowy practices are obscured from advocates and lawmakers alike. But through the stories of those fighting to free their loved ones, and those who have done time on the inside, this film will shine a light on a facility too often shrouded in darkness.
This panel will focus specifically on the healthcare consequences of privatized ICE detention facilities.

Today, over 400,000 people are booked into ICE custody, a policy of mandatory detention started in 1996 by President Clinton. 
‚Äã
Running and operating these facilities is GEO Group, a multi-billion dollar Florida-based private prison company with a track record of wage theft, forced labor, false record-keeping, poor oversight and detainee mistreatment. 
 
This film addresses seriously the federal government's ability to detain people, highlighting some of the most common areas of neglect, including medical neglect/abuse, nutrition issues and prolonged detention. 
‚Äã
    According to federal government data, GEO Group receives more taxpayer dollars for immigration detention than any other ICE contractor
 
So we start at the source to tell this story, with interviews from current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and the experts and advocates trying to save lives while a pandemic rages inside.

Watch the trailer here:

https://www.thefacilitymovie.com/

Register here:
https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_vy-sxiNKQaO7HsWjRXRThA
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Community alert: Protestors in Denver continue to be contacted and interrogated by the FBI....
item.content:encoded:
Community alert: Protestors in Denver continue to be contacted and interrogated by the FBI.

Please give these resources a read and message us for links!

https://www.nlg.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/kyrpamphlet-Eng-May-2015-FINAL.pdf

https://ccrjustice.org/files/CCR_If_An_Agent_Knocks.pdf

https://m4bl.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/2020-6-10_M4BLCLEAR_FBIEncounters_FINAL.pdf

Thanks to @coloradonlg for their ongoing support against state repression! Call the legal line at 720-822-5893 if you are contacted by the FBI
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of ‚ÄúThe Facility.‚Äù ...
item.content:encoded:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Since we began fighting with Elijah McClain's family 15 months ago, power has done everything possible to serve power...
item.content:encoded:
Since we began fighting with Elijah McClain's family 15 months ago, power has done everything possible to serve power and silence us.

However, this obvious state repression only fans the People's flames!

Those in power tried to take away public comment at city council, the DA's still have Elijah classified as a suspect, fascists have burned down his memorial multiple times, the kops took disgusting reenactment photos of Elijah's murder (the only kop fired so far has been fired for taking these depraved photos), a city councilman sicked the far right on us on with the assistance of a local Nazi radio station, the kops helped a bro attempt to run us over on the highway (breaking a woman's leg), the kops tear-gassed us, beat us, and then two DA's put our comrades in jail for 8 days without a bond hearing and are STILL trying to keep them in cages for for up to 40 YEARS. And now Democratic governor @govofco and @philforcolorado -after the Adams and Arapahoe DA's and APD tried to cage the movement-thinks we aren't going to notice the weak ass shit he is pulling with the state investigation during Thanksgiving holiday?!? APD also tried to release body cam footage to the family and media last Thanksgiving thinking people wouldn't notice!

Democrat politicians always call for "investigations" and "studies" to silence and tire activists and Polis is doing more of the same. Polis knew about Elijah before this summer. Polis knew all along. Let's be real: calling for an investigation into police murder is the Dem Party equivalent of "thoughts and prayers."

We will not take down these watered-down concessions from Dems! Elijah's mother wants these cops and paramedics PROSECUTED

We are watching, we won't stop fighting and we will march and dance and holler until Elijah's mother gets what she asked for--and APD is fucking ABOLISHED

@justiceforelijahmcclain @denverpsl

Wednesday night in Denver

If money can move freely across borders, why can't people and workers?

Down with settler colonialism and border imperialism!

item.title: Via AFSC Colorado...
item.content:encoded:
Via AFSC Colorado

***sigue en espanol ***

With the recent outbreak, COVID 19 threatens the lives of everyone imprisoned. #DetentionIsDeadly.

Immigration and Customs Enforcement’s decision to return to business as usual and its GEO detention center in Aurora are not keeping our community safe, and experts agree, the only answer is to #FreeThemAll. Just last month, Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes called for compassionate humanitarian release of all imprisoned people. Join us Monday, November 9th at 6:00 pm at 3130 Oakland in Aurora for a Caravan around the detention center and virtually on FB Live. We will hear from family and impacted individuals and from the Colorado Immigrant Freedom Fund about how your donations can free our people! This event is brought to you by the American Friends Service Committee, the Colorado People’s Alliance, the Colorado Freedom Fund AND the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.

Con el reciente brote, COVID 19 amenaza la vida de todos los encarcelados. #DetentionIsDeadly. La decisión del Servicio de Inmigración y Control de Aduanas de volver a la normalidad y su centro de detención GEO en Aurora no mantiene a nuestra comunidad segura, y los expertos coinciden en que la única respuesta es #FreeThemAll. El mes pasado, el Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes pidió la liberación humanitaria compasiva de todas las personas encarceladas. Únase a nosotros el lunes 9 de noviembre a las 6:00 pm en 3130 Oakland en Aurora para una caravana alrededor del centro de detención y virtualmente en FB Live. ¡Escucharemos a familiares e individuos afectados y al Fondo de Libertad de Inmigrantes de Colorado sobre cómo sus donaciones pueden liberar a nuestra gente! Este evento es presentado por el American Friends Service Committee, la Colorado People's Alliance, el Colorado Freedom Fund Y el Colorado Immigrant Freedom Fund.
